itemLabel: Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising

wikipedia_page.main: Greville Patrick Charles Howard, Baron Howard of Rising (born 22 April 1941) is a British Conservative politician and, before the 2010 general election, was variously an Opposition Whip and Shadow Minister for Cabinet Office, for Treasury and for Culture, Media and Sport.

response: *1941 – Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising, English politician

link_mentions.page: List of barons in the peerages of Britain and Ireland

response: Several other members of this branch of the Howard family have also gained distinction. The Hon. Edward Howard, younger son of the first Earl of Suffolk, was created Baron Howard of Escrick in 1628. The Hon. Henry Thomas Howard, second son of the 16th Earl, sat as Member of Parliament for Cricklade. The Hon. James Howard, fourth son of the 16th Earl, sat as Member of Parliament for Malmesbury. His grandson was the explorer and politician Charles Howard-Bury. The Hon. Greville Howard, younger son of the 19th Earl, sat as Member of Parliament for St Ives.  The life peer, Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising, is the great-grandson of the Hon. Greville Howard, second son of the 17th Earl.
* Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising
* Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising (born 1941), British politician, Conservative Party life peer since 2004

Howard died on 5 January 1958. In 1908, he had married Miriam Eleanore Dansey, daughter of Lieutenant-Colonel Edward Mashiter Dansey and his wife the Hon. Eleanor Gifford, daughter of Robert Gifford, 2nd Baron Gifford;Burke's Peerage (2003), vol. 3, p. 3816. she died in 1969. They had two children, a daughter Diana who died young, and a son Henry Redvers Greville Howard (1911–1978), an army officer and the father of Greville Howard, Baron Howard of Rising."Howard of Rising, Baron, (Greville Patrick Charles Howard)", Who's Who (online ed., Oxford University Press, 2021). Retrieved 24 July 2021.
